text:
Svidrigaïlov and Achilles stared, silence hanging thick between them. 

“What do you want here?” Achilles asked, unmoving. 

“Nothing, brother, good morning,” Svidrigaïlov replied. 

“This isn’t the place.” 

“I am going to foreign parts, brother.” 

“To foreign parts?” 

“To America.” 

Svidrigaïlov cocked his revolver. 

Achilles raised his eyebrows. 

“This isn’t the place for such jokes!” 

“Why shouldn’t it be?” 

“Because it isn’t.” 

Svidrigaïlov shrugged. 

“It’s a good place. Just say he was going to America.” 

He pressed the gun to his temple. 

“You can’t do it here!” Achilles shouted, eyes wide. 

Svidrigaïlov pulled the trigger.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov, contemplating suicide, confronts Achilles while preparing to use a revolver.
